results.title: Still flying
results.creator_credit: Robert Stephenson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Award winning animated short about an old air force veteran who reminisces about the war years. Mostly a claymation work, Stephenson uses hand-drawn 2D animation to indicate the flashbacks experienced by the the veteran whilst supping on his beer at his local pub. The veteren, who struggles to find meaning in his old age, draws on his experiences of the past in a heady mix of booze and disillusionment in an attempt to make sense of his life. Voices: Graeme Jackson, Andrea Lang.

results.title: Sticky moments with Julian Clary
results.creator_credit: John Henderson, Tom Yardley, Channel Four and Wonderdog Productions
results.brief_description: Two episodes from a 1989 television comedy show hosted by Julian Clary in which the outrageously dressed, openly gay comedian challenges contestents to participate in absurd activities. Clary also sings and performs comedy skits. This was the first television series to star Clary who has become a regular on British television and is also known for his live shows. The show ran for eleven episodes from October to December 1989. It was written and conceived by Clary and Paul Merton.

results.title: Steve Reich : A New Musical Language
results.creator_credit: Margaret Williams and Mary Jane Walsh
results.brief_description: Tonal, repetitive, insistently rhythmic, Reich’s compositions have emerged in the 1980’s as one of the central influences in contemporary music. This film covers Reich’s work over the last twenty years, from the early tape pieces to recent orchestral work, with extracts from concerts filmed in England and New York. Conductor, Michael Tilson Thomas, who has worked closely with Reich, assesses his impact on, and contribution to, contemporary music. Reich himself talks with candour and considerable humour about his life and musical development.

results.title: Sterilizing wool blankets for hospitals
results.brief_description: Woollen blankets as the most hygienic hospital bed covering and the procedures for sterilising them. Tests demonstrate how woollen blankets without counterpane are least likely to harbour and transfer bacteria. How blankets may be sterilised by boiling in a slightly acid detergent solution without losing shape, size or texture. The laundry procedures involved. Largely photographed in the Central Linen Service of the Royal Melbourne Hospital.

results.title: Stereoscopic Viewer and cards
results.brief_description: Stereoscopic viewers were an extremely popular home entertainment device in the Victorian era, their ability to create 3D images allowed users to travel the world without leaving their homes.
results.description: A stereoscope viewer is a device for viewing stereoscopic images which are made up of two separate images, with slightly differing perspectives that roughly correspond to the spacing of both the left and right the eyes. When the image is viewed through the stereoscopic viewer, the pair of images converge into a single three-dimensional picture.
description_for_label: A stereoscope viewer is a device for viewing stereoscopic images which are made up of two separate images, with slightly differing perspectives that roughly correspond to the spacing of both the left and right the eyes. When the image is viewed through the stereoscopic viewer, the pair of images converge into a single three-dimensional picture.

results.title: Stephen Banner: supervisor
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Commonwealth Public Service Board
results.brief_description: At all levels, work and efficiency depends upon supervision. The supervisors’ efficiency always determines the efficiency of his section. Shows how a supervisor, although competent in their own field, may lack the qualities of a good supervisor. Emphasises that a supervisor should ask the following questions: WHAT does my section do?, WHY does my section do this work? and HOW does my section perform this work?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Commonwealth Public Service Board

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Aid given to cerebral palsied children. Private individuals seeing the need established Spastic centres. Basic school syllabuses are slightly modified to suit the physical and mental ability of each child. Special equipment compensates for handicaps. Difficulty in mixing with others can be overcome with specialised aid in the play centres. Teaching them to walk, balance and control movements, and teaching the deaf to speak require highly specialised therapy.

results.title: Steffan the violin maker
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Shows the painstaking process of violin making by focussing on sixteen year old Steffan Kellar, an apprentice violin maker and violinist living in West Germany. Highlights the beauty of the violin as a musical instrument, as well as indicating its cultural heritage.

results.title: Steer 270
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan, Brian Voce and Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Follows a task force made up of the ships Perth, Derwent and Supply, of the Royal Australian Navy on a good will cruise of Mauritius Island, Mombasa, Karachi, Singapore, and Sydney.
